definition[0]: a vehicle used for travelling or carrying things into space, which is shaped like a big tube
example[0]: The rocket was launched from a space research base.
definition[1]: a weapon shaped like a big tube that is fired at things
definition[2]: a firework that goes high into the air before exploding into coloured lights
definition[3]: a plant with green leaves and a strong taste, eaten raw in salads
definition[4]: if a price or amount rockets, it increases quickly and suddenly
example[4]: Car sales rocketed from 180 to 2000 a year.
example[5]: The train rocketed through the tunnel.
example[6]: Larssonâ€™s shot rocketed into the back of the net.
definition[6]: to achieve a successful position very quickly
example[7]: Their new album rocketed to number one in the charts.
example[8]: Beatty rocketed to stardom after his first film.
